item.title: The 1908 Tunguska event and some distant phenomena
item.description: arXiv:2511.17549v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper is a continuation of a series of works, devoted to various aspects of the 1908 Tunguska event. This usually refers to an explosive phenomenon associated with the appearance of a forestfall, named nowadays as the Kulikovskii one. However, several other notable natural phenomena occurred in the Central Siberia on June 30, 1908. This paper considers geomorphological features, reports of substance discoveries, forestfalls, and earthquakes. The general conclusion is that the Tunguska event was a very complex phenomenon. Research of the Tunguska event requires the participation of experts in various fields.
item.dc:creator: Andrei Ol'khovatov
